perturbation.original_text:
S2K hereby represents and warrants to the Distributor that:
(ii) It and all requisite personnel have or shall obtain and each shall use their best efforts to maintain all approvals and licenses necessary for the performance of the Services including proper registration and licensing with the SEC and or FINRA, as applicable;
perturbation.changed_text:
S2K hereby represents and warrants to the Distributor that:
(ii) It and all requisite personnel will attempt to obtain and maintain approvals and licenses necessary for the Services including registration and licensing with the SEC and FINRA, as applicable, if it is practical.
perturbation.explanation: By changing "have or shall obtain and each shall use their best efforts to maintain" to "will attempt to obtain and maintain" and adding the condition of "if it is practical", the obligation becomes vague and unenforceable. It is not clear what constitutes an "attempt" or what makes obtaining or maintaining a license "impractical." This weakens S2K's responsibility to be properly licensed.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and Investment Company Act of 1940, which require specific registrations and licenses for entities and individuals engaged in securities-related activities.

perturbation.original_text: S2K shall devote sufficient staff and expenditures to the performance of its services as shall be consistent with industry standards for the marketing of shares of the Fund. S2K shall perform these services in a professional and competent manner and shall provide such office space and equipment, telephone facilities and personnel as it determines may be reasonably necessary or beneficial in order to provide such services at no cost to the Distributor.
perturbation.changed_text: S2K shall endeavor to provide staff and resources for its services as it deems fit. S2K will strive to perform the services competently and will furnish office space and equipment it considers potentially helpful.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing "sufficient staff and expenditures...consistent with industry standards" with "staff and resources as it deems fit" introduces subjectivity and removes a benchmark for performance. Similarly, "strive to perform competently" is weaker than "shall perform in a professional and competent manner," and "potentially helpful" makes the provision of resources discretionary. This affects S2K's required level of commitment.
perturbation.contradicted_law: FINRA Rules on Standards of Commercial Honor and Principles of Trade, which require members to conduct business with high standards of commercial honor and just and equitable principles of trade. The changes weaken the commitment to professional standards.

perturbation.original_text:
Each party hereto agrees that any “Nonpublic Personal Information,” as the term is defined in Regulation S-P (17 CFR 248.1 –
248.30) (“Reg S-P”), may be disclosed by a party hereunder only for the specific purpose of permitting the other party or parties to perform
services set forth in this Agreement. Each party agrees that with respect to such information, it will comply with Reg S-P and any other applicable
Federal or state regulations and that it will not disclose any Nonpublic Personal Information received in connection with this Agreement to any
party except to the extent required to carry out the services set forth in this Agreement or as required by applicable law.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party hereto acknowledges that “Nonpublic Personal Information,” as defined in Regulation S-P (“Reg S-P”), might be disclosed. Each party will attempt to adhere to Reg S-P to the extent feasible and will avoid disclosing Nonpublic Personal Information unnecessarily.
perturbation.explanation: By changing "agrees to comply" with Reg S-P to "will attempt to adhere to Reg S-P to the extent feasible," the obligation becomes discretionary. The addition of "unnecessarily" introduces a subjective judgment, weakening the protection of Nonpublic Personal Information under Reg S-P.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Regulation S-P (17 CFR 248.1 – 248.30), which mandates strict rules regarding the handling and protection of nonpublic personal information by financial institutions.
